prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing apology greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "ai for good was awesome
"
Style: âœ¨ Smart Style
Tone: ðŸ¤ª Quirky - unique and unconventional
To: nabila
From: craig warner
Message: "sorry for the mixup on the pitch scheduling - craig"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the unique and unconventional tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way








Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "apology" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a beautiful and intricate botanical watercolor style. Imagine delicate, hand-painted sprigs of olive branches and eucalyptus leaves, rendered in soft, muted greens and dusty blues, gently curving around the edges of the card. The colors bleed softly into the textured, off-white paper, creating a feeling of peace and organic warmth. Tiny, almost hidden, golden-yellow mimosa blossoms are dotted throughout the foliage, adding a subtle touch of brightness and optimism. The overall effect is one of gentle sincerity and thoughtful craftsmanship, a visual peace offering that feels both personal and heartfelt.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a apology card with unique and unconventional tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a beautiful and intricate botanical watercolor style. Imagine delicate, hand-painted sprigs of olive branches and eucalyptus leaves, rendered in soft, muted greens and dusty blues, gently curving around the edges of the card. The colors bleed softly into the textured, off-white paper, creating a feeling of peace and organic warmth. Tiny, almost hidden, golden-yellow mimosa blossoms are dotted throughout the foliage, adding a subtle touch of brightness and optimism. The overall effect is one of gentle sincerity and thoughtful craftsmanship, a visual peace offering that feels both personal and heartfelt.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "sorry for the mixup on the pitch scheduling - craig" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in a beautiful and intricate botanical watercolor style. Imagine delicate, hand-painted sprigs of olive branches and eucalyptus leaves, rendered in soft, muted greens and dusty blues, gently curving around the edges of the card. The colors bleed softly into the textured, off-white paper, creating a feeling of peace and organic warmth. Tiny, almost hidden, golden-yellow mimosa blossoms are dotted throughout the foliage, adding a subtle touch of brightness and optimism. The overall effect is one of gentle sincerity and thoughtful craftsmanship, a visual peace offering that feels both personal and heartfelt.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a beautiful and intricate botanical watercolor style. Imagine delicate, hand-painted sprigs of olive branches and eucalyptus leaves, rendered in soft, muted greens and dusty blues, gently curving around the edges of the card. The colors bleed softly into the textured, off-white paper, creating a feeling of peace and organic warmth. Tiny, almost hidden, golden-yellow mimosa blossoms are dotted throughout the foliage, adding a subtle touch of brightness and optimism. The overall effect is one of gentle sincerity and thoughtful craftsmanship, a visual peace offering that feels both personal and heartfelt.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover: Front cover of a greeting card with a 9:16 ratio. The artwork features a cute, stylized cartoon robot with bright blue glowing eyes and a friendly expression, waving with one hand. The robot is entangled in a large, colorful mess of wires and cables in vibrant hues of red, orange, yellow, green, and blue, with various connector types visible at the ends. The background is a deep, solid navy blue. Above the robot, the word "Oops..." is written in a playful, bright pink, slightly slanted cursive font. Small, yellow starbursts or sparks are scattered around the robot, adding a touch of playful chaos. The overall style is flat 2D illustration with bold outlines and a slightly retro feel, exuding a quirky and lighthearted tone, fitting for an apology. The text "Oops..." is positioned in the upper central area, safely away from the top edge.
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a flat 2D illustration style. The background is a solid, deep indigo blue. In the center of the composition, a stylized, bright yellow electrical plug is connected to a blue electrical outlet. A thick, vibrant orange cord extends from the plug and curves downwards, forming a smooth, simplified line. At the end of the cord, a stylized, simple white hand is shown giving a thumbs-up gesture. Three small, dashed white lines emanate from the thumb, suggesting a positive affirmation or success. The overall design is clean, minimalist, and uses bold, flat colors with thick black outlines. There is no text or specific branding, and the composition is centered with plenty of negative space. The design evokes a sense of completion, connection, and approval, fitting a theme of "AI for good was awesome" and a "thumbs up" outcome. There is no visible space reserved for a QR code.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a "Friendly A.I. Brain" theme, presented in a flat, 2D illustrative style with a bold and quirky aesthetic. The background is a deep navy blue, mimicking the overall card's color palette. Dominating the center is a large, rounded square, bright yellow, depicting a friendly AI core with simple, smiling eyes and a curved smile. Extending from this central unit are various stylized lines and shapes representing connections and functions, rendered in vibrant pink and electric blue. To the upper left, a yellow, cloud-shaped element labeled "GOOD IDEAS" is connected via pink lines. To the upper right, a blue rectangular box with four blue play-arrow symbols inside is labeled "CAT VIDEO STORAGE," also connected by pink lines. Below this, a blue circular icon with a yellow center, labeled "CALENDAR SYNC," is similarly connected. Further down on the right, a tall blue rectangular container, labeled "QUANTUM COFFEE MAKER," is depicted with steaming lines and a blue coffee cup beneath it, all connected by the network of pink lines. In the lower left, a pink electrical plug with yellow lightning bolts emanating from it is shown, hinting at power or a potential glitch, also integrated into the network. The overall composition is reminiscent of a circuit diagram, but with playful and abstract elements that convey a sense of quirky functionality and personality. The entire illustration is clean, graphic, and uses a limited but high-contrast color palette, creating a visually engaging and unconventional design.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a vintage computer monitor theme. The monitor displays a dark navy blue screen with a cream-colored bezel. A stylized, light teal robotic arm with a two-fingered gripper is shown extending from the left side of the screen, holding a rectangular, coral-colored card. On this coral card, handwritten in a flowing, slightly whimsical cursive script, is the message: "sorry for the mixup on the pitch scheduling - craig". The monitor screen itself is filled with a pixelated-style graphic of scattered square blocks in shades of coral, teal, and mustard yellow, with a denser "brick-like" pattern of these same colors forming a lower section of the screen. The overall aesthetic is flat, 2D, and incorporates a retro, slightly quirky technological vibe with a limited, bold color palette.
